definition[0]: to have or express a different opinion from someone else
example[0]: Barr strongly disagreed with Kronfeld’s statement.
example[1]: He is tolerant of those who disagree with him.
example[2]: Experts disagree on how much the program will cost.
definition[1]: if statements, numbers, or reports about the same event or situation disagree, they are different from each other
example[3]: The statements of several witnesses disagree.
explanation[1]: You disagree with an idea, or something that someone says
example[5]: I disagree with his views on the economy
bad_example[1]: I disagree his views on the economy
example[6]: Experts disagree about the answer to this question
example[7]: Parents often disagree on the best way to bring up children
example[8]: Scientists disagree over whether oil is unhealthy
explanation[3]: You say I disagree when you do not agree with what someone says
example[9]: ‘Women are better drivers than men’ ‘I disagree’
definition[2]: to have a different opinion from someone else about something
example[10]: Scholars disagree about the meaning of the poem.
example[11]: I don’t agree with a word of what she says.
definition[3]: if a group of people is divided or split on something, some of them have one opinion and others have a completely different opinion
example[12]: The party is divided on this issue.
definition[4]: if two or more people differ about something, they have different opinions from each other about it
example[13]: The two men differed on how to handle the crisis.
definition[5]: used to say that two people have different opinions and ideas so that it is difficult for them to be friends or work together
example[14]: Some of the teachers don’t see eye to eye with the principal of the school.
definition[6]: used to say that you disagree with someone’s opinion and that you think they are wrong
example[15]: People are mistaken if they think that this problem will go away on its own.
definition[7]: to express strong disagreement with an idea or with what someone has said or done
example[16]: A number of people took issue with the mayor’s decision.
definition[8]: to say publicly that you disagree with an official opinion or one that most people accept
example[17]: Two members of the jury dissented from the majority verdict.
definition[9]: to have or express a different opinion from someone
example[18]: They disagree on how much the project will cost
example[19]: Some of the team disagreed with him, but they were too afraid to say so.
example[20]: The figures in column A and B disagree.
